intro: Trichipteris phalerata, commonly known as the broad-leaved hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and along roadsides, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are broad and lobed, with a rough texture, and its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Trichipteris phalerata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and ease of cultivation.
